name: Python
description: A versatile high-level programming language known for its readability and extensive libraries.

name: JavaScript
description: A high-level, interpreted scripting language primarily used for front-end web development.

name: Java
description: A class-based, object-oriented programming language designed for portability across platforms.

name: C++
description: An extension of the C language, providing high performance and control over hardware.

name: Go
description: A statically typed, compiled language designed at Google for building efficient and reliable software.

name: Rust
description: A multi-paradigm systems programming language focused on safety and performance.

name: Swift
description: A powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

name: Kotlin
description: A modern, concise, and interoperable programming language for JVM, Android, and browser.

name: Ruby
description: A dynamic, open-source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.

name: PHP
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language especially suited to web development.

name: Scala
description: A high-level language that combines object-oriented and functional programming.

name: Haskell
description: A purely functional programming language with a strong static type system.

name: Express.js
description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework.

name: Django REST framework
description: A powerful and flexible toolkit for building Web APIs in Django.

name: Spring Boot
description: An opinionated framework for building production-ready Spring applications.

name: Ruby on Rails
description: A web application framework that includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications.

name: Flask
description: A lightweight WSGI web application framework in Python.

name: FastAPI
description: A modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.

name: .NET Web API
description: A framework for building HTTP services that can be accessed from any client.

name: PostgreSQL
description: A powerful, open-source object-relational database system.

name: MySQL
description: A popular open-source relational database management system.

name: MongoDB
description: A source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker.

name: Cassandra
description: A free and open-source, distributed, wide column store, NoSQL database management system.

name: SQLite
description: A C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

name: Microsoft SQL Server
description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft.

name: Oracle Database
description: A multi-model database management system produced and marketed by Oracle Corporation.

name: Couchbase
description: A distributed NoSQL cloud database that offers robust capabilities for business-critical applications.

name: Memcached
description: A general-purpose distributed memory caching system.

name: Hazelcast
description: An open-source in-memory data grid based on Java.

name: RabbitMQ
description: An open-source message broker software that originally implemented the Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP).

name: Apache Kafka
description: A distributed event streaming platform capable of handling trillions of events a day.

name: ActiveMQ
description: An open-source message broker written in Java together with a full Java Message Service (JMS) client.

name: ZeroMQ
description: A high-performance asynchronous messaging library.

name: NATS
description: A simple, high-performance open-source messaging system for cloud-native applications, IoT messaging, and microservices architectures.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.

name: Angular
description: A platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript.

name: Vue.js
description: A progressive framework for building user interfaces.

name: Svelte
description: A radical new approach to building user interfaces, where work is shifted from the browser to the compile step.

name: Ember.js
description: A productive, battle-tested JavaScript framework for building modern web applications.

name: Backbone.js
description: A JavaScript library with a RESTful JSON interface and is based on the Model-View-Presenter (MVP) application design paradigm.

name: React Native
description: A framework for building native mobile apps using React.

name: Flutter
description: Google's UI toolkit for building beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

name: Xamarin
description: An open-source platform for building modern and performant applications for iOS, Android, and Windows with .NET.

name: Jenkins
description: An open-source automation server which enables developers around the world to reliably build, test, and deploy their software.

name: GitLab CI
description: A part of GitLab used to build, test, and deploy applications.

name: GitHub Actions
description: Automate, customize, and execute your software development workflows right in your GitHub repository.

name: CircleCI
description: A continuous integration and delivery platform that helps software teams work smarter, faster.

name: Travis CI
description: A hosted continuous integration service used to build and test software projects hosted at GitHub.

name: Spinnaker
description: An open-source, multi-cloud continuous delivery platform for releasing software changes with high velocity and confidence.

name: AWS (Amazon Web Services)
description: A comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally.

name: Azure
description: Microsoft's cloud computing service for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services.

name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
description: A suite of cloud computing services offered by Google.

name: DigitalOcean
description: A cloud computing platform that offers virtual private servers (VPS), or 'droplets'.

name: Heroku
description: A platform as a service (PaaS) that enables developers to build, run, and operate applications entirely in the cloud.

name: Vercel
description: A cloud platform for static sites and Serverless Functions that fits perfectly with your workflow.

name: Docker
description: A set of platform-as-a-service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

name: Kubernetes
description: An open-source container orchestration system for automating software deployment, scaling, and management.

name: Podman
description: A daemonless container engine for developing, managing, and running OCI Containers on your Linux System.

name: Nginx
description: A web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache.

name: Apache HTTP Server
description: A free and open-source cross-platform web server software.

name: Caddy
description: An extensible, cross-platform, open-source web server written in Go.

name: LiteSpeed
description: A high-performance, lightweight HTTP server.

name: Apache Hadoop
description: A framework that allows for the distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers.

name: Apache Spark
description: A unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing.

name: Apache Flink
description: An open-source, unified stream-processing and batch-processing framework.

name: Presto
description: An open-source distributed SQL query engine for running interactive analytic queries against data sources of all sizes.

name: TensorFlow
description: An end-to-end open-source platform for machine learning.

name: PyTorch
description: An open-source machine learning library based on the Torch library.

name: scikit-learn
description: A free software machine learning library for the Python programming language.

name: Keras
description: An open-source software library that provides a Python interface for artificial neural networks.

name: Prometheus
description: An open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit.

name: Grafana
description: A multi-platform open-source analytics and interactive visualization web application.

name: Datadog
description: A monitoring service for cloud-scale applications, providing monitoring of servers, databases, tools, and services.

name: New Relic
description: An observability platform that helps you build better software.

name: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
description: A popular suite for log management and analytics, combining Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana.

name: Strapi
description: An open-source headless CMS to easily build customisable APIs.

name: Contentful
description: A content platform that lets you create, manage and distribute content to any platform.

name: Sanity.io
description: A platform for structured content that comes with an open-source editor built in React.

name: Directus
description: An open-source data platform that instantly wraps any SQL database with a real-time GraphQL+REST API for developers, and an intuitive admin app for non-technical users.
